-- read a single csv file
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/03/data/2019.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]

-- read a single text file
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/03/data/2019.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]


-- read only csv files in a single folder
    -- folder may contain many other file types
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/03/data/*.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]
order by OrderDate DESC



-- read a all csv files in a single folder
    -- folder must contain only csv files
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/03/data/',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]
order by OrderDate DESC

-- read data with schema (WITH)
    -- orginal files don`t have headers
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/02/data/*.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    )
    WITH (
            SalesOrderNumber VARCHAR(10) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_BIN2_UTF8,
            SalesOrderLineNumber INT,
            OrderDate DATE,
            CustomerName VARCHAR(25) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_BIN2_UTF8,
            EmailAddress VARCHAR(50) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_BIN2_UTF8,
            Item VARCHAR(30) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_BIN2_UTF8,
            Quantity INT,
            UnitPrice DECIMAL(18,2),
            TaxAmount DECIMAL (18,2)
    ) AS [result]

-- using filepath() in results with csv files
    -- reading all csv files in a folder
SELECT
    TOP 100 *,
    [result].filepath(1) -- returns file name
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/02/data/*.csv',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]

    -- reading partitioned folder recursively
SELECT
    TOP 100 *,
    [result].filepath(1) -- returns subfolder+filename
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/02/csv/**',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]

    -- reading partitioned folder
SELECT
    TOP 100 *,
    [result].filepath(1) -- returns subfolder
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/02/csv/year=*/',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0'
    ) AS [result]

-- read single parqeut file
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/02/data/2019.snappy.parquet',
        FORMAT = 'PARQUET'
    ) AS [result]



-- read all parqeut files in a folders recursivly
    -- only parquet files are in the folder
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/02/parquet/**',
        FORMAT = 'PARQUET'
    ) AS [result]


-- using filepath() in results with parquet files
SELECT
    TOP 100 *,
    [result].filepath(1)
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/02/parquet/year=*/',
        FORMAT = 'PARQUET'
    ) AS [result]


-- read and aggregating parquet data
SELECT
    YEAR(OrderDate) AS OrderYear,
    COUNT(*) AS Order_Items
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/02/parquet/**',
        FORMAT = 'PARQUET'
    ) AS [result]
GROUP BY YEAR(OrderDate)
ORDER BY OrderYear


-- read parquet data from partitions
SELECT
    YEAR(OrderDate) AS OrderYear,
    COUNT(*) AS Order_Items
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/02/parquet/year=*/',
        FORMAT = 'PARQUET'
    ) AS [result]
WHERE [result].filepath(1) IN ('2019', '2020')
GROUP BY YEAR(OrderDate)
ORDER BY OrderYear

-- read json files
SELECT TOP 100
    jsonContent
    ,JSON_VALUE (jsonContent, '$.SalesOrderNumber') AS SalesOrderNumber
    ,JSON_VALUE (jsonContent, '$.CustomerName') AS CustomerName
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/02/data/*.json',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        FIELDQUOTE = '0x0b',
        FIELDTERMINATOR ='0x0b',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '0x0b'
    )
    WITH (
        jsonContent varchar(MAX)
    ) AS [result]

-- read any text file
    -- tab seperated file
    -- rows are in new lines
SELECT TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://datalake9nlosdj.dfs.core.windows.net/files/dp-203/Allfiles/labs/02/text/sample.txt',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        -- FIELDQUOTE = '0x0b',
        FIELDTERMINATOR = '\t', 
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS [result]
